title: Math Learning - Education Week
text:
Math Learning Report Roundup Math Learning "Math at Home Adds up to Achievement in School" 
Using a word-problem app to talk about mathematics at home once a week can boost math achievement, particularly for students with parents who dread the subject. 
In a randomized controlled trial published this month in the journal Science, researchers at the University of Chicago followed 587 1st graders and their families at 22 Chicago-area schools. The families were randomly assigned to use an iPad with either a reading-related app or Bedtime Math, an app which provides story-like math word problems for parents to read with their children.
